New Records: Coby White nearly recorded a triple-double with 23 points, 10 rebounds, and nine assists.
Torrey Craig scored 18 points and made five three-pointers after halftime.
Key Match Events: The game went into overtime after Miles Bridges missed a potential tying three-pointer.
Nikola Vucevic missed two free throws, allowing Charlotte to send the game to overtime.
Patrick Williams scored a crucial corner three-pointer in overtime to extend the Bulls' lead.
Pre-Game Insights: The Bulls' strategy involved strong perimeter defense, as discussed by coach Steve Kerr.
The absence of LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller due to injuries impacted the Hornets' performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Chicago Bulls coach Charles Lee expressed relief after the overtime victory.
Charlotte Hornets guard Miles Bridges was highlighted for his strong performance despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was marked by a high-energy overtime period and significant player absences.
Tre Mann's injury further complicates the Hornets' bench strength.
Others: The game was Charlotte's 17th loss in 18 games, extending their losing streak.
The Bulls improved to 15-18 with the win.
